ratings.comment: I thought the costume test and the costume portion of the final exam were much harder than they needed to be. A lot of the information was not covered in the lectures and was far too in-depth for a survey course.

A fairly easy class, maybe a little challenging for non-theatre students who aren't familiar with the topics. Jim has a very blunt sense of humor, so if you get offended easily, avoid this class. Stay on his good side!

Although Theatre 160 is a collaboratively taught class by 4 instructors, Jim definitely takes the lead. It's clear that he enjoys teaching his section. He responds to emails promptly and has a very clear syllabus. Show up to the classes and you'll be just fine!

Jim is very organized and responsive.  His syllabuses are very helpful and he always lets you know what is going on.  He grades things right away and is fair--gives reasons for lower grades.  He has a fun sense of humor to go with all the great information that he also has to offer.  Without one of his classes, your theatre experience isn't comlete
